President Xi wrote back to Adam Foster, president of Helen Foster Snow Foundation, acclaiming the Snow family's contribution to China-US relations.  https://t.co/fiSBCOBaxF

The Beijing 2022 Winter Olympics will be the start of a new era for winter sports worldwide with over 300 million Chinese taking up winter sports, said IOC President Thomas Bach. #GLOBALink https://t.co/45byxeYqiN

The road ahead is bumpy. Both countries are in the process of rediscovering each other and finding an appropriate way to get along. A good relationship has to be based on mutual respect, peaceful coexistence and win-win cooperation.
China's gross domestic product (GDP) expanded 8.1 percent year on year in 2021 https://t.co/YhhcJvGWyo
Live: Chinese President #XiJinping delivers 2022 New Year address #XiNewYearAddress https://t.co/DjyP2TttOo
‚ú®üéâ40 days to go until #Beijing2022! üéâHoliday greetings from the amazing Genting Snow Park‚ùÑ, one of the #WinterOlympics2022 venues in Zhangjiakou, China ‚ù§ https://t.co/foiiVWgphA

40 days to go before #Beijing2022. China's 55 world champions extended their invitation in a song: welcome to Beijing, see you in Beijing! 
https://t.co/UVaQ5p4CN3

‚ú®üéá50 days to go until #Beijing2022Beijing, the world's first #DualOlympicCity, was built along a 7.8km-long central axis. üß≠The axis showcases the beauty of the city's balance and 3,000 years of history and development. #Olympics athletes will soon achieve their dreams hereüí™‚ùâ https://t.co/QZtBe1E489

The Summit for #Democracy is an evident product of Cold-War mentality. It will stoke up ideological confrontation and a rift in the world, creating new ‚Äúdividing lines.‚Äù This trend contradicts the development of the modern world.

We do sometimes compete, but we should follow the recognized rules like table tennis players, have fair and healthy competition, respect each other, appreciate each other, learn from each other, and make progress together.

President Xi also pointed out, ‚Äúthe most important event in international relations in the coming 50 years will be for China & the US to find the right way to get along.‚Äù I hope that our two peoples will know more about #PingPongDiplomacy and learn from history.

As President Xi pointed out during his virtual meeting with President Biden, "the most important event in international relations over the past 50 years was the reopening and development of China-US relations." This most important event started from a small ping pong ball. https://t.co/4yecuURAra

President Xi is having a virtual meeting with US President Biden. Both #China and the #US are at critical stages of development. They need to manage domestic affairs well while shouldering international responsibilities. https://t.co/qitv35LS4U
President Xi also announced the establishment of Beijing Stock Exchange as the primary platform serving innovation-oriented small-and-medium-sized enterprises. https://t.co/sNw1KO0Ft9

The two sides should work in the same direction and make every preparation to ensure a smooth and successful meeting and bring bilateral relations back onto the track of sound and steady development. https://t.co/94k68QMZZS

China and the US issued the Joint Glasgow Declaration on Enhancing Climate Action in the 2020s. The two sides will establish a working group to meet regularly to address the climate crisis & advance the multilateral process, focusing on enhancing concrete actions in this decade.

The 15th meeting of the Conference of the Parties to the UN Convention on Biological Diversity (#COP15) is set to kick off on Oct. 11 in Kunming, the capital of southwest China's Yunnan Province. https://t.co/YSy2uIGxwJ

The US now seeks to ‚Äúrecouple‚Äù with China, which has some positivity in it. The two sides can sort out the areas of decoupling & how to get them ‚Äúrecoupled‚Äù. We are willing to talk with the US & expand the positive side on the basis of mutual respect & win-win cooperation, https://t.co/5f4uKBBV7r

Taking China as ‚Äúthe most important geopolitical threat in the 21st century‚Äù is the most serious miscalculation. President Biden said the US is not seeking a new Cold War. But shouldn‚Äôt the Cold War playbook, travestied from 007 movies, be just left to Hollywood blockbusters? https://t.co/bDcKXZv8ke

What is China‚Äôs traditional virtue? It means a concern for the common good of humanity. To quote a Chinese poem, ‚Äúhow wonderful it would be if there could be tens of thousands of houses to shelter those in need, together in joy!‚Äù

These buzzwords reflect the changing & unchanging elements in our values amidst rapid economic growth & profound social changes. We need to keep fine traditional values, uphold fairness and justice, and not get lost in a market economy.

Seventh, celebrity fan clubs. Some celebrities used the Internet to hype up themselves, and their fans crazily imitated them. Commercialization is having an excessive influence on the entertainment industry, and the government is introducing regulating measures.
Fifth, involution. It means irrational or involuntary competition. Because of it, people feel burned out, and individual efforts are made less worthwhile.

Fourth, Versailles, originally from the Palace of Versailles in France. On social media, it is used to label humble-braggers, who pretend to sound modest when they flaunt their rich and unique lifestyle.
Third, lie flat, which describes the youngsters who give up ambitions and do the bare minimum to get by.

Second, heroes in harm‚Äôs way, which refers to the everyday heroes who put their mission before their lives and made fearless sacrifices to fight the pandemic. They held on to their posts day and night to keep people‚Äôs daily life up and running at a special time.

The first #buzzword I shared with the audience yesterday was people first, life first. It's rooted in Chinese history and reflects a deep concern for humanity. Putting people at the center is a guiding principle of the CPC & a core value of socialism with Chinese characteristics.

To get a true, multi-dimensional and panoramic view of China, I encourage you to go to China and get an immersive experience of my country. I hope that the pandemic will be over soon, so that you can visit China for study, work and fun. https://t.co/WGv89CdVLD

My pleasure to attend the Forum on Tourism, Hospitality and Cultural Exchange organized by @usasiainstitute and share with everyone some #buzzwords in China, which I hope will help you know better about China and the Chinese people. https://t.co/iOepe7XtuY https://t.co/lV5pV8iLVp

Exclusive: Chinese ambassador @AmbQinGang says China-U.S. relations in "exploring" period 

more: https://t.co/kprCyTO9c8 https://t.co/1tA2ql7hnr

Chinese Ambassador to the U.S. Qin Gang says China-U.S. relations are in the running-in process in an exclusive interview with CGTN. ‚ÄúThrough this process, to rediscover the other side, re-recognize each other, so as to find a way to get along,‚Äù Qin added. #CGTNAmerica https://t.co/wDiePVNtnG
Exclusive: Chinese ambassador to U.S. @AmbQinGang sends wishes for National Day. #PRC72 https://t.co/8E85s2vQ8N

I thank Assistant Secretary Daniel Kritenbrink, @NCUSCR Board Chair Jacob Lew, @USChinaBusiness President Craig Allen & Ms. Florence Fang for joining the Embassy's National Day reception. I appreciate all the brilliant artists. Thank you all for watching. https://t.co/g25raLC7Rb

A joy spending the morning with the new Chinese Ambassador to the United States, His Excellency @AmbQinGang.

The Ambassador is a kindred spirit. Great discussion on strengthening US-China ties through the vehicle of culture, students exchanges, and core shared values.
#US #China https://t.co/OJCvxy3MAk

China and the US can advance coordination and cooperation on climate change, COVID-19 response and economic recovery. These areas are innovation intensive. The US side also needs to create conditions, instead of barriers, for our cooperation.

The Chinese never believe in ‚ÄúThucydides trap‚Äù. We will open a path of national renaissance & peaceful development. We call on the US to uphold peaceful dvpt, abandon wrong thinking, and work with China to find a way of getting along based on mutual respect & win-win cooperation.

Mankind is a community with a shared future. No country can solve the world‚Äôs difficulties and challenges alone, and no country can stand aloof from them. China and the US need to show broad vision and shoulder great responsibilities.
For China-US relations, innovation is a ‚Äúgolden key‚Äù to some thorny issues. We need a new vision, new thinking and new methodology.

China's high-quality development will be empowered, first and foremost, by innovation. Innovation is at the core of China‚Äôs overall development, and comes the first in the new development philosophy: innovative, coordinated, green, open and shared development.
‚ÄúNew‚Äù is the mother of innovation, which takes mankind forward. https://t.co/sdS11ahdsA

Had a good talk at Bloomberg New Economy Forum meeting. ‚ÄúNew‚Äù is the mother of innovation, which takes mankind forward. Hope that we will explore new solutions to global challenges, look for new ways to spur post-pandemic recovery, and tap new potential of China-US cooperation. https://t.co/pH8qY8P8um

One country‚Äôs success does not have to mean another country‚Äôs failure. We need to pursue dialogue and inclusiveness over confrontation and exclusion. China has never and will never invade or bully others, or seek hegemony.
Democracy is not a special right reserved to an individual country, but a right for the people of all countries to enjoy.

China has pledged an additional three billion US dollars of international assistance in the next three years to support developing countries in responding to COVID-19 and promoting economic and social recovery.
China will step up support for other developing countries in developing green and low-carbon energy, and will not build new coal-fired power projects abroad.

We should care about special needs of developing countries. We may employ such means as debt suspension & dvpt aid to help developing countries, esp. vulnerable ones facing exceptional difficulties, focusing on addressing unbalanced & inadequate dvpt among & within countries.

President Xi at UNGA: We should safeguard and improve people‚Äôs livelihoods and protect and promote human rights through development, and make sure that development is for the people and by the people, and that its fruits are shared among the people.

If a country likes to talk about safeguarding a rules-based international order, but does not follow the rules set by itself, or only follows them selectively, or keeps flip-flopping, how can you expect other countries to trust this country?
On climate change, China and the US must first do their own things well. We must honor our words with real actions.

There isn‚Äôt any example in the history of international relations where the political relationship between two countries is in competition or even confrontation but other spheres remain safe and sound.

What I worry about is that the US uses competition to define China-US relations, while competition on the US side often means confrontation, esp. on issues concerning China‚Äôs core interests. If this doesn't change, it will hurt our efforts for mutual trust & cooperation.
We hope that the US side will lift the iron curtain between our people, and allow our students, scholars, scientists and artists to talk and work together without fear and obstacles.

China is a powerhouse & source of confidence for Asian & world economy and trade, and a strong link of global supply chain. It's striving towards common prosperity, and committed to high-level opening-up. This means a broader market & greater opportunities for Asian countries.
We never say that our system is the best, because we know only the suited is the best. Whether it is good or not should not be judged by what we say, but what we do.

China is just pursuing peace, development, fairness, justice, democracy and freedom, which are common values of mankind. Both China‚Äôs people-centered philosophy and President Lincoln‚Äôs ‚Äúof the people, by the people, for the people‚Äù are for the sake of the people.

China is not perfect. There are many difficulties & challenges on our way. But we are deepening reform, improving socialist democracy, and modernizing national governance. These efforts are to meet the people‚Äôs aspiration for a better life & make greater contribution to mankind.

A Harvard Kennedy School survey shows the Chinese people‚Äôs satisfaction of the CPC has been over 90% for 10 years. Changchun has had a Mayor‚Äôs Hotline for 22 years, and people‚Äôs satisfaction has remained 90+%. If you know about it, is it hard to understand the survey results?
Whether a system is democratic depends on whether it can represent the overall interests of the people and whether the people are satisfied. Democracy is not for embellishment; it should deliver.
A Chinese has to receive all kinds of trainings, assessments , selections & oversight in his/her lifetime. CPC members are also subject to Party disciplines, which are stricter than the law.

In ancient China, talents were chosen by abilities & merit. An ancient philosopher said, ministers must have served as local officials; generals must have risen from the ranks. China had an imperial exam system 1400+ years ago, the original form of the West's civil service system

In the public consultations for the 14th Five-Year Plan, 1,000+ suggestions were summarized from 1 million+ online posts, and 366 edits were made to the draft. After the deliberations by the NPC and the CPPCC, another 55 adjustments were made before the adoption of the Plan.
When drafting the Civil Code, there had been ten rounds of collection of public opinions, and over one million opinions were gathered from more than 420,000 people.

What China has today is whole-process democracy. All major legislations and decisions are made through scientific and democratic processes and extensive consultations, to make sure what the people want are reflected in the final decisions.

In Plato's theory of education, people who have survived all the trials and tribulations no long engage in empty talk, and they become determined and experienced. So they would be put on governing positions.
Whatever political system a country chooses, its purpose is to select appropriate persons to govern the country and create a better life for the people.

A basic criterion of democracy should be whether the people have the right to govern their country, whether their needs are met, and whether they have a sense of fulfillment and happiness. At the center of democracy is people.

Some Americans try to define America‚Äôs relations with China as democracy versus authoritarianism, and to stoke up ideological confrontation, which has led to serious difficulties in China-US relations.

Had a conversation with @CarterCenter & @GHWBushChina on democracy. It's wrong to define China-US relations as democracy vs authoritarianism. What China has is whole-process democracy: from the people, to the people, with the people, for the people. https://t.co/LMtCrV8hzn https://t.co/FzbxTA4QuD
China will continue to support and engage in global science-based origins¬†tracing, and stands firmly opposed to¬†political maneuvering¬†in whatever form.

Ensuring fair & equitable distribution of vaccines globally is imperative. China will strive to provide 2 billion doses of vaccines to the world by end of 2021. Besides donating $100 Mln to COVAX, China will donate 100 Mln doses of vaccines to other developing countries in 2021.

President Xi: We must beat COVID-19 & win this decisive fight crucial to the future of humanity. We should put people & their lives first, care about life, value & dignity of every individual. We need to respect science, take a science-based approach & follow the laws of science.

Neither Section 301 investigations nor tariff war has worked. It is hoped that necessary conditions and atmosphere can be created for the implementation of the phase one agreement and bilateral economic and trade exchanges, rather than making things worse.

On concerns about the uncertainties in China-US relations, what I can offer is the certainty from the Chinese side. China‚Äôs economy is promising, its market potential is huge, and its door of opening-up will only open wider.

If we compare China-US relations to a giant ship, then economic and trade cooperation has been its ballast and propeller. When the ship sails against heavy winds and huge waves, we need to add more strength to the ballast and propeller.

Reform and opening-up is just like crossing the river by feeling the stones. When new problems occur, we must try to resolve them with new solutions. We will create a fair and law-based market environment, and make our policies more predictable.

China's economy enjoys¬†a¬†good¬† momentum¬†&¬†bright prospects. It will remain the source of confidence, growth and hope for world economic recovery in the post-pandemic era, and will provide vast market and great opportunities for foreign investors, including American ones.
